“Alright. We've seen what we're up against, and we know it's only going to get more difficult from here. Who wants out?” Kainzo turns to face the raid, claymore hefted on one shoulder. Behind him, the tunnel the crystalline Construct charged you from—there's myriad doors lining the walls of that hallway, but you've elected to wait before moving to avoid triggering any traps. The spiral staircase circles the Inner Sanctum wall, leading upward as high as you can see; from above, there's a distant, echoic sound of metal scratching on glass, rhythmic like footsteps.

“I'm gonna have to log for about two minutes here.” Andor says. “I'll be back, though.”

“My weapons aren't really doing much of anything.” Nel says, nervously.

“I see.” Dorian scoffs. “You're going to crawl away now that you've got your prize?”

“S-shut up! I didn't say I wanted to leave!” Nel turns, reaching for his blades. “I'll...”

“You'll what?” Dorian folds his arms.

> [[ Continued ]]
